  "Allegations" : "[CUSTOMER] ALLEGED THAT MR. ROWE PLACED TWO UNPROFITABLE, UNAUTHORIZED TRADE IN HIS ACCOUNT AND CLAIMED THAT THIS WAS DONE IN ORDER TO MAKE UP A LOSS FROM A MUTUAL MISUNDERSTANDING OVER A DUPLICATED SALE AND LOSS ON THE RESULTING SHORT POSITION.  [CUSTOMER] CLAIMED REIMBURSEMENT ON THE LOSS OF THE SHORT POSITION ($10,000) ND THE LOSSES ON TE ALLEDGED UNAUTHORIZED TRADES ($10,067).  UPON REVIEW OF THE EVIDENCE, INCLUDING RECORDS OF TELEPHONE CALLS AND THE CUSTOMER'S TRADING HISTORY, THE BROKER-DEALER FOUND A REASONABLE BASIS ON WHICH TO CONCLUDE THAT THE DISPUTED TRANSACTIONS WERE GOOD TRADES AND THAT AT WORST THE ORIGINAL DUPLICATED SALE WAS AN HONEST MUTUAL ERROR.  IN ORDER TO AVOID COSTS OF POTENTIAL LITIGATION, THE BROKER-DEALER NEGOTIATED A SETTLEMENT IN THE AMOUNT OF $20,067.  THE BROKER'S CONTRIBUTION OF $11,739.20 TO THE AMOUNT OF THE SETTLEMENT WAS FINALIZED IN JUNE 1987.  MR. ROWE DENIED THAT THERE WAS A MUTUAL MISUNDERSTANDING ABOUT THE DUPLICATED SALE.  HE CLAIMED THAT [CUSTOMER] PLACED BOTH THE BUY AND SELL WITH HIM AND THEN MISTAKENLY DUPLICATED THE SELL AT ANOTHER FIRM LEAVING HIMSELF SHORT ON THE ORIGINAL SELL ORDER.  MR. ROWE ALSO DENIES THT THE TWO SUBSEQUENT DISPUTED TRADES WERE UNAUTHORIZED AND CLAIMS THAT [CUSTOMER] SIMPLY RENEGED ON UNPROFITABE TRADES.",
